articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 9th in E (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 9th in E (Shape: A)

An arpeggio is the playing of the tones of a chord in quick succession rather than simultaneously. The 9th arpeggio in E refers to playing the "9th" note in E major scale, which is F#, along with the other tones of the E major chord.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G# (3rd)
- B (5th)
- D# (7th)
- F# (9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, with the added 9th note, gives a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to the music. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and sometimes in rock music to add color and depth to chord progressions. The 9th adds tension and color to the chord, making it sound more rich and complex.

## Songs
1. "Little Sunflower" by Freddie Hubbard
2. "So What" by Miles Davis
3. "Europa" by Carlos Santana
